TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HitTestResult extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the results of a hit test.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> class represents the results of a hit test, and is exposed as the return object from a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.HitTest%2A> method call.
A hit test checks a specified point in the chart to determine if a chart element is located at that point. If a chart element is detected, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> class is used to obtain information about that chart element.
If a chart element is found, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.Object%2A> property returns a reference to the chart element; the only exception to this being <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects, in which case the return value of this property is `null`.
If a data point is located, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.PointIndex%2A> property to get the index of that data point; that is, the zero-based index of the point in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection>. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.Series%2A> property to get the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object for that data point.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.ChartArea%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.Axis%2A> properties are used to get the associated chart area and axis of the chart element - if any - returned by the hit test. Note that these properties may be `null` if the returned chart element does not have an associated chart area or axis.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartElementType> property to determine the type of the chart element returned by a hit test.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object that may be associated with a chart element returned by a hit test. The presence of an associated object depends on whether a chart element was detected at the given location, and the type of chart element returned.
Docs.value: An object, otherwise . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the chart object returned by the hit test is an object that is associated with an axis - for example, a scrollbar element, tick mark, grid line or strip line - the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.Axis%2A> property will reference the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object with which the returned chart object is associated. Otherwise this property will be `null`.
Note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.HitTest%2A> method can be called explicitly, in which case a chart element may or may not be at the specified location.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ChartArea ^ ChartArea { System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ChartArea ^ get(); void set(System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::ChartArea ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object that may be associated with a chart element returned by a hit test. The presence of a object depends on whether a chart element was detected at the given location, and the type of chart element returned.
Docs.value: A object, otherwise . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a Chart object is returned by the hit test, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.ChartArea%2A> property will reference the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object that is associated with the returned chart element.
If no chart element is returned by the hit test, the value of this property will be `null`.
**Note** The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.HitTest%2A> method can be called explicitly, in which case a chart element may or may not be at the specified location.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of chart element, if any, returned by a hit test.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that indicates the type of chart element returned by a hit test. Defaults to .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this property to determine the type of chart element, if any, returned by a hit test.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object, if any, returned by a hit test.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a chart element is located at the point that is checked by the hit test, this property will reference that chart element, otherwise the value of this property will be `null`.
> [!NOTE] > If a data point is returned by the hit test, this property will still return a `null`. To obtain information about the data point, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.PointIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.Series%2A> properties instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int PointIndex { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.PointIndex : int with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the index of a data point, if any, returned by a hit test.
Docs.value: An value that represents the index of a data point returned by a hit test. The default value is negative one (-1).

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a data point is at the location that is checked by a hit test, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.PointIndex%2A> property will return the zero-based index of that data point, otherwise it will return a negative one (-1).
All data points are stored in a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection>, which is exposed as the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.Points%2A> collection property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object; the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection> is zero-based.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.Series%2A> property to determine the series to which the data point belongs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::Series ^ Series { System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::Series ^ get(); void set(System::Web::UI::DataVisualization::Charting::Series ^ value); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the associated series of a data point, if any, returned by a hit test.
Docs.value: The that a data point returned by a hit test belongs to. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a data point is at the location checked by a hit test, this property will reference the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object that the data point belongs to. If no data point is returned by the hit test, the value of this property will be `null`.
To determine the index of a returned data point, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult.PointIndex%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the sub-object, if any, returned by a hit test.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An example of a sub-object is an <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> object that is displayed inside a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object.
